result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:00 AM Defendant Katera A Haucke not in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Katera A Haucke.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Klein indicates her client is sick and is requesting a new date for plea and sentencing before Christmas. 
Court grants request but stays a capias until the next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Klein requests a plea/sentencing date.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on March 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:56 AM Defendant Katera A Haucke in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court provides defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel and informs defendant to fill out and turn in the Petition prior to leaving the courthouse today.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court will authorize the defendant to appear by zoom for the next date.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
